# datacutr

SDTM Datacut in R

## Purpose

To provide an open source tool that enables the pharmaceutical
programming community to apply a data cut to SDTM data in R.

## Installation

The package is available from CRAN and can be installed by running the
following,

``` r
install.packages("datacutr")
```

To install the latest development version of the package directly from
GitHub use the following code::

``` r
if (!requireNamespace("remotes", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("remotes")
}

remotes::install_github("pharmaverse/datacutr", ref = "devel")
```

## Scope

This package works with tabulation data following an SDTM standard. For
ease of processing, the assumption is that supplemental qualifiers have
been combined with their parent domain prior to the application of the
cut process (sometimes labeled as SDTMv). The user has the flexibility
to select the type of cut applied to each SDTM domain (either no cut,
patient cut, date cut, or a special DM cut).

## References and Documentation

- Please go to [Get
  Started](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/articles/datacutr.html)
  section to start using
  [datacutr](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/)
- Please go to [Function
  Reference](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/index.html)
  section for a break down of all functions created by
  [datacutr](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/)
- Please see the [Contribution
  Model](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/articles/contribution_model.html)
  for how to get involved with making contributions

The following support and communications between user and developer
community is recommended:

- [Slack](https://app.slack.com/client/T028PB489D3/C02M8KN8269) - for
  informal discussions, Q&A and building our user community. If you
  donâ€™t have access, use this

  to join the pharmaverse Slack workspace
- [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/pharmaverse/datacutr/issues) - for
  direct feedback, enhancement requests or raising bugs

# Package index

## Derivations

- [`apply_cut()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/apply_cut.md)
  : Applies the datacut based on the datacut flagging variables
- [`create_dcut()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/create_dcut.md)
  : Create Datacut Dataset (DCUT)
- [`date_cut()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/date_cut.md)
  : xxSTDTC or xxDTC Cut
- [`impute_dcutdtc()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/impute_dcutdtc.md)
  : Imputes Partial Date/Time Data Cutoff Variable (DCUTDTC)
- [`impute_sdtm()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/impute_sdtm.md)
  : Imputes Partial Date/Time SDTMv Variables
- [`process_cut()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/process_cut.md)
  : Wrapper function to prepare and apply the datacut of SDTMv datasets
- [`pt_cut()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/pt_cut.md)
  : Patient Cut
- [`read_out()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/read_out.md)
  : Function to generate datacut summary file
- [`special_dm_cut()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/special_dm_cut.md)
  : Special DM Cut to reset Death variable information past cut date

## User Utilities

- [`drop_temp_vars()`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/drop_temp_vars.md)
  : Drops Temporary Variables From a Dataset

## Data

- [`datacutr_ae`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/datacutr_ae.md)
  : Adverse Events SDTMv Dataset
- [`datacutr_dm`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/datacutr_dm.md)
  : Demographics SDTMv Dataset
- [`datacutr_ds`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/datacutr_ds.md)
  : Disposition SDTMv Dataset
- [`datacutr_fa`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/datacutr_fa.md)
  : Findings About Events or Interventions SDTMv Dataset
- [`datacutr_lb`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/datacutr_lb.md)
  : Laboratory Test Results SDTMv Dataset
- [`datacutr_sc`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/datacutr_sc.md)
  : Subject Characteristics SDTMv Dataset
- [`datacutr_ts`](https://pharmaverse.github.io/datacutr/reference/datacutr_ts.md)
  : Trial Summary SDTMv Dataset
